a:1:{i:0;a:2:{s:5:"title";s:47:"Task 2 Writing - Understanding Marking Criteria";s:7:"content";s:847:"IELTS Task 2 Writing is assessed using four marking criteria: 1. Task Response - This assesses whether you have addressed all parts of the question, presented a clear position, developed your arguments with relevant ideas and examples, and written at least 250 words. 2. Coherence and Cohesion - This evaluates how well you organize and link your ideas using paragraphs and cohesive devices (e.g., however, furthermore, in addition). Your arguments should be presented in a clear, logical order. 3. Lexical Resource - This examines your vocabulary range, the accuracy of word choice, and your ability to paraphrase rather than repeating words from the question. Using a variety of vocabulary demonstrates lexical range. 4. Grammatical Range and Accuracy - This assesses your use of different sentence structures (simple, compound, complex) and grammatical accuracy.";}}
